text: Coons, Judiciary Cmte member,  says he hopes cmte holds a hearing with AG Barr and Mueller. Says it "would certainly be a way to inform the general public about what we did and didn’t get and why"
author: JonathanTamari

text:
Sen. Chris Coons (D, Del) says once Congress gets conclusions of Mueller report "It’s entirely possible that that will be a good day for the president and his supporters"
But says Congress still has broader mandate to investigate, more to be done on accountability/transparency
author: JonathanTamari

text:
GOP @RepBrianFitz - ex FBI agent - says Mueller report should be released in full:
 “100% full transparency on all investigative matters and full disclosure to the public”
author: JonathanTamari

text: “I’m just looking for somebody that has dignity and morals and values" For many Dems, beating Trump and trying to restore a feeling of normalcy is more important than any single policy debate:
author: JonathanTamari

text:
“Mentally rational human being with empathy would be a good start,” said one Dem when asked what she was looking for in 2020. 
https://www.philly.com/news/trump-democrats-normalcy-behavior-20190322.html …
author: JonathanTamari

text:
Medicare for all? Green New Deal? For 2020, some Dems would settle for something simpler: Normalcy.
https://www.philly.com/news/trump-democrats-normalcy-behavior-20190322.html …
author: JonathanTamari

text:
Rendell, FWIW, has been one of the most vocal Dems urging 2020 candidates to stick to the center and not veer left.
Has said he's likely to support Biden if he runs.
author: JonathanTamari

text:
Inbox: Ed Rendell joins the board of Dem Super PAC/oppo research group American Bridge.
So do Jennifer Granholm, Andrew Gillum, ex-DCCC official Jessica Mackler
author: JonathanTamari

text: The fact that this is seen as necessary months after he was eulogized in national services is incredible
author: JonathanTamari

text:
The McCain Institute has released a set of facts about John McCain. Among them:
He fought for his country in the Vietnam War. 
He was held for 5 years in a Vietnamese prison and brutally tortured. He refused early release ... insisting ...those taken first must be released first
author: JonathanTamari

text: The President of the United States uses an official White House event to bash a recently deceased war hero senator
author: JonathanTamari

text:
A sober @JasonNark story on the 40th anniversary of the Three Mile Island meltdown and resulting health issues, punctuated by this moment of humor:
“Shut it down,” Dan Quaka said while smoking a cigarette.
author: JonathanTamari

text:
One Dem who saw Beto in PA supports Gillibrand specifically because she lacks celebrity appeal.
“We’re in a lot of trouble. We need someone who wants to solve problems and does not want to draw attention to themselves as a personality.”
author: JonathanTamari

text:
One Dem voters liked that Beto didn't make big promises he can't keep, or pretend to have every answer. “He’s on the same fact-finding mission that I am,” she said.
https://www.philly.com/politics/election/beto-orourke-penn-state-pennsylvana-speech-20190319.html …
author: JonathanTamari

text:
At Penn State, some Dems swoon for Beto's energy, while others want policy details: 
https://www.philly.com/politics/election/beto-orourke-penn-state-pennsylvana-speech-20190319.html …
author: JonathanTamari

text:
And more than a few people drew comparisons between Beto and Obama, who staged a massive rally at Penn State before the 08 primary: 
https://www.philly.com/politics/election/beto-orourke-penn-state-pennsylvana-speech-20190319.html …
author: JonathanTamari

text:
"We need someone who wants to solve problems and does not want to draw attention to themselves as a personality" says one Dem at Beto's event.
A friend, though, valued charisma: 
https://www.philly.com/politics/election/beto-orourke-penn-state-pennsylvana-speech-20190319.html …
author: JonathanTamari

text:
Updated: In an early visit to PA, @BetoORourke shows the state's importance of the state in 2020, while stirring the Dem debate about sweeping themes vs vs policy detail: 
https://www.philly.com/politics/election/beto-orourke-penn-state-pennsylvana-speech-20190319.html …
author: JonathanTamari

text:
One pointed PA question for Beto:
“When are we going to get an actual policy from you instead of platitudes and nice stories?” 
https://www.philly.com/politics/election/beto-orourke-penn-state-pennsylvana-speech-20190319.html …
author: JonathanTamari

text:
In State College, Pa. Beto says US democracy is “as broken as it has been in our lifetimes”
https://www.philly.com/politics/election/beto-orourke-penn-state-pennsylvana-speech-20190319.html …
author: JonathanTamari

text: Beto - in the white shirt - leading a “We are!” “Penn State” chant in a huge crowd at PSU
author: JonathanTamari

text:
Beto on climate change/if he supports the Green New Deal:
"The only way to match that threat and that opportunity is with bold action ... let’s be bold, let’s come together, let’s get this done."

Which is not really an answer about whether he supports that specific plan
author: JonathanTamari

text: Update: the Penn State hat lasted about 13 minutes
author: JonathanTamari

text:
Beto gets some of his biggest applause from students at PSU when he brings up climate change.
Says if it continues "we are screwed - and that is the term the scientists use"
author: JonathanTamari

text: At Penn State, Beto points early to the college admissions scandal as a symbol of inequality: "We have fellow Americans with an extra $3 or $4 million which they can use to game the college admissions process"
author: JonathanTamari

text:
A Dem voter here at the Beto event on what she wants in a nominee:
"A mentally rational human being with empathy would be a good start"
author: JonathanTamari

text: Off in the distance there Beto O’Rourke is wearing a white Penn State ballcap as he speaks to a crowd loaded with PSU student
author: JonathanTamari

text: that's a good point. i made a similar one about the contrast (primary vs general) in my full write up:
author: JonathanTamari

text:
interesting question.
Olympian? Women's World Cup winner? college basketball champ?
author: JonathanTamari

text: Beto O'Rourke is visiting State College, PA on Tuesday. Believed to be the first 2020 Dem to hold a public event in PA: https://www.philly.com/news/beto-orourke-pennsylvania-state-college-visit-20190318.html …
author: JonathanTamari

text: i'm guessing yes but that is a question some Dem consultants have posed to me as well
author: JonathanTamari

text: State College specifically? or that region more broadly?
author: JonathanTamari

text:
Interesting choice on location - far from the Dem strongholds that matter most in a primary (not that PA is likely to play a major role in the primary)
But connects with youthful vibe, and idea that Beto is willing to go to regions where Dems sometimes ignore
author: JonathanTamari

text:
Beto O'Rourke is coming to PA tomorrow - State College.
This is the 1st public event of any declared 2020 Dem in PA that I'm aware of: 
https://www.facebook.com/events/250400175912555/ …
author: JonathanTamari

text:
ah, I missed the sarcasm.
Thanks for responding.
author: JonathanTamari

text: GOP Congressman from Bucks County, PA >>>
author: JonathanTamari

text:
statistics also say that undocumented immigrants who commit violent crimes are a tiny fraction of the overall group.

Trump sees them as a national emergency
author: JonathanTamari

text: is nothing sacred?
author: JonathanTamari
